column4: hi every body! any one can help me for an easy way to upgrade my gcc to 4.6 in Lucid ?
Is there any repo to add and apt-get it to do all? I also need g++ to be the same version
How do I set sda to have deadline scheduler right at boot, so that the rest of the disks still get cfg scheduler? (I have ssd as sda, other drives are normal spindles...)

I know the elevator=deadline line to /etc/default/grub GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT... but it changes the default elevator. The rest of the disks get the same elevator. I could echo to /sys/block/... at boot time, but then when usb hdds are attached, they too get the deadline elevator...
Ok which sources I should get !? for both g++ and gcc ?
can you lead me a link?
no, but google is your friend
there might be a repo also, but I don't know about those
yes you right I'm in hury and I can't think on what i say :D
one another Q ! does g++ have another source for itself ? or gcc contains g++ ?
